channel.title: Metals Industry News Feed
channel.description: Automated news feed for aluminum, steel, copper, and nickel industries

item.title: Autonomous Copper Refining at Olympic Dam: Tech Guide - Olympic Dam's Revolutionary Autonomous Copper Refining Technology Breakthrough
item.description: Olympic Dam has introduced a revolutionary autonomous copper refining technology featuring robotic arms for advanced processing. This innovation represents a breakthrough in copper metallurgy and processing technology. The article provides a tech guide on this development published today.

item.title: FNI unit ships first nickel ore cargo for 2026
item.description: Ipilan Nickel Corp., a subsidiary of Global Ferronickel Holdings, Inc., shipped its first nickel ore cargo of 2026, consisting of 53,912 wet metric tons of low-grade nickel ore to China. The company targets production of at least 1.5 million WMT for the year, with a sales mix of 52.6% low-grade and 47.4% medium-grade ore. Mine development includes expanding areas, building haul roads, and installing environmental protections to meet targets while complying with regulations.

item.title: Solway to restart Guatemala nickel plant after price surge
item.description: Swiss-based Solway Investment Group plans to restart its PRONICO nickel plant and CGN mine in Guatemala within months, following a nickel price surge to $19,160 per ton and the lifting of U.S. sanctions. The facility has an annual capacity of 25,000 metric tons of ferronickel, with the mine capable of extracting up to 2.2 million tons of nickel ore. Restart is anticipated around April to May 2026, indicating high prices are enabling resumption of previously curtailed production.

item.title: Global Ferronickel unit sets 2026 output target
item.description: Global Ferronickel announced that its Ipilan unit has commenced 2026 mining operations with the first nickel ore shipment. The company has set specific output targets for the year amid ongoing operations.

item.title: Nickel Industries cements leadership in ENC, welcomes Sphere as strategic partner
item.description: Nickel Industries increased its stake in the ENC project to 46%, becoming the largest shareholder, while Sphere acquired a 10% interest at a US$2.4 billion valuation, reducing cash outflows by US$207 million. The company secured a 15-year MOU for 14 million WMT/year limonite ore supply for the Sampala Project. This strengthens financial flexibility and positions Nickel Industries for battery-grade nickel production as ENC nears commissioning.

item.title: Nickel Industries completes strategic partner’s entry into ENC project, revises acquisition terms
item.description: ASX-listed Nickel Industries completed Sphere's entry into the ENC project and revised acquisition terms. The update enhances project ownership and financial terms for the nickel processor.

item.title: Nickel Industries cements leadership in ENC, welcomes Sphere as strategic partner
item.description: Nickel Industries increases its stake in the ENC project to 46%, becoming the largest shareholder, while welcoming Sphere as a 10% strategic partner at a US$2.4 billion valuation. This deal reduces future cash outflows by US$207 million and secures a 15-year exclusive limonite ore supply MOU for the Sampala Project. The partnership supports transition to battery-grade nickel and cobalt for electric vehicles, enhancing supply chain reliability.

item.title: The Proportion of Liquid Aluminum in January Declined, Expected to Further Drop in February
item.description: China's aluminum production in January 2026 rose 2.7% year-over-year and 0.5% month-over-month, but the proportion of liquid aluminum fell 4.4 percentage points to 72.1% due to weak demand, high prices, and production restrictions. Casting ingot volume decreased 5.9% YoY but increased 19.4% MoM. In February, production is expected to decline with fewer days, and liquid aluminum proportion to drop further to 64.4% amid Chinese New Year and high prices.

item.title: The Proportion of Liquid Aluminum in January Declined, Expected to Face a Significant Drop in February: SMM Analysis
item.description: China's aluminum production in January 2026 increased 2.7% year-over-year and 0.5% month-over-month, but the proportion of liquid aluminum declined 4.4 percentage points to 72.1% due to weak demand, high prices, and production restrictions. item.title: Steel Pulls Back from 5-Month High
item.description: Steel rebar futures in China fell to CNY 3,100 per tonne after reaching five-month highs of CNY 3,160 on January 29. The pullback reflects pressure on prices following recent gains.

item.title: Copper Eases from Surge in Volatile Session
item.description: Copper futures in the US surged over 10% to a record high of $6.5 per pound before trimming gains to the $6.2 mark in a volatile trading session. Markets gauged the fundamentals behind the recent speculative rally as copper led the surge in base metals amid bets of higher demand.

item.title: Why are copper prices rising now: 5 reasons
item.description: Copper prices hit an all-time high of $14,125 per metric ton on the London Metal Exchange, representing a 7.9% single-day surge. The rally stems from a perfect storm of speculative intensity, structural supply deficits, AI-driven demand, and geopolitical factors including tariff uncertainty.

item.title: 3 Top Copper Stocks to Watch as Copper Prices Skyrocket: BHP, FCX, SCCO
item.description: Major copper producers rallied as copper prices extended gains, driven by supply disruptions in South America, China's infrastructure stimulus, and accelerating demand from electric vehicle and renewable energy sectors. Copper futures are up 40% since August, with major producers like Southern Copper surging 132% over the past year.

item.title: Copper Surges Past US$14,000: Best ASX Copper Stocks for 2026
item.description: Copper prices hit record highs of US$14,527 amid AI data centre demand and supply shocks. The article highlights top ASX copper stocks positioned to benefit from the sustained rally.

item.title: Steel Rises Toward 5-Month High
item.description: Steel rebar futures in China rose to CNY 3,150 per tonne, approaching five-month highs of CNY 3,160 from January 7th. The rally was driven by efforts to improve the financial balance of Chinese property developers, which stoked optimism for ferrous metal demand.

item.title: Nickel Eases from 19-Month High
item.description: Nickel futures eased to $18,500 per tonne from a 19-month high of $19,000 in late January. Markets are assessing lower supply from major producers after Indonesia signaled output cuts by reducing mining permits to 260 million wet tonnes. Despite the recent dip, contracts remain sharply higher year-to-date amid supply risks.

item.title: Nickel fell to 17,555 USD/T on January 30, 2026
item.description: Nickel prices dropped 5.21% to 17,555 USD/T on January 30, 2026, after sinking to $17,700 per tonne due to a rebounding dollar closing speculative positions in base metals. Over the past month, prices rose 4.81%, and year-over-year they are up 15.27%. UK nickel futures hovered near $19,000 throughout January before the decline.

item.title: Nickel is down by 5.03%
item.description: Nickel decreased 5.03% to 17,588 USD/T on January 30, 2026. This follows a pullback from recent highs amid broader base metals weakness. Year-to-date gains persist due to supply concerns.

item.title: LME aluminium jolts the market as cash offer slides to $3,110 per tonne
item.description: LME cash aluminum bid dropped sharply from $3,323 to $3,109 per tonne, a 6.4% decline, with 3-month contracts also falling around 6%. Inventories decreased slightly by 2,000 tonnes to 495,725 tonnes on January 30. The move highlights market volatility amid ongoing supply and demand shifts.

item.title: Large aluminum deposit near Tisdale could enhance industry in Sask
item.description: A massive aluminum deposit, the Thor Project near Tisdale, Saskatchewan, contains over 6.8 billion tonnes of alumina within a small 16x16 mile area, equating to about a third of known world supply. Canadian Energy Metals' Preliminary Economic Assessment confirms an inferred resource of 86.6 billion tonnes. The deposit allows for the greenest method to produce aluminum.

item.title: Rio Tinto Strengthens Its Global Low-Carbon Aluminium Footprint Through Joint Acquisition with Chalco of Votorantim's Interest in CBA
item.description: Rio Tinto and Chalco jointly acquired Votorantim's interest in CBA to strengthen their global low-carbon aluminum production capabilities. This strategic move supports the industry's transition toward sustainable aluminum production and decarbonization efforts.

item.title: Green Nickel, Global Future
item.description: Neo Energy is redefining Indonesia's nickel sector through integrated mining, processing, and industrial development on a sustainable platform. The company operates over 12,000 hectares of nickel mines and green-powered industrial parks, including a high-pressure acid leach (HPAL) facility targeted for 2029 completion. These efforts position Indonesia centrally in the global energy transition.

item.title: Sources say that India will unveil incentives for lithium and nickel processing
item.description: India plans to offer incentives, including a 15% capital subvention starting April 1, 2026, for companies setting up nickel and lithium processing plants to boost production and support its energy transition. This addresses the lack of domestic processing capacity, currently dominated by China, amid targets for 30% electric car penetration by 2030. The initiative focuses on critical minerals essential for EV batteries.

item.title: US ALUMINUM: Extruders remain cautious for 2026 after an up-and-down 2025
item.description: US aluminum extruders express caution for 2026 amid high billet costs, import competition, and uncertain trade policies, despite some strong January demand. New orders for extruded products rose 5.1% through November 2025 vs 2024, but shipments fell 1.4%. Expectations include potential tariff reforms on Canadian P1020 to lower premiums and boost demand.

item.title: CME Hikes Copper Margins Amid Record Price Surge
item.description: Global copper prices have reached unprecedented levels, prompting CME Group to raise margins on copper futures by 20% effective January 30, 2026, due to extreme volatility. Prices on the LME exceeded $6 per pound, or over $14,000 per metric tonne. Analysts like Goldman Sachs forecast a decline to $11,000-$11,500 per tonne by year-end 2026 amid potential U.S. tariffs.

item.title: Chalco, Rio Tinto to Buy Brazil's CBA in $886 Million Push for Greener Aluminum
item.description: China's Chalco and Rio Tinto will acquire a 68.6% stake in Brazil's Companhia Brasileira de Alumínio (CBA) for $886 million to secure low-carbon aluminum supply amid surging prices. CBA, powered by renewable energy, produced 364,500 tons in 2024, over one-third of Brazil's output. The deal supports greener production as aluminum futures hit record highs near $3,356 per ton.

item.title: Is aluminium scrap quietly rewriting the global metals playbook especially with EU scrap tension from solar PV India's new policies
item.description: The article examines how global aluminium scrap flows, prices, and policies are shifting, with particular focus on India's new regulations adding secondary aluminium to its list of regulated industries under the Greenhouse Gases Emission Intensity Target Rules, 2025. It highlights NALCO's plans to develop 200-300 MW of renewable power capacity paired with battery storage to reduce coal dependence and support sustainable aluminium smelting, while also addressing the challenge of recycling aluminium from solar installations, which now account for 8 million tonnes globally.

item.title: Aluminum Beverage Can Market Outlook 2026-2034
item.description: The market analysis projects the aluminum beverage can market will grow from $41.9 billion in 2025 to $57.4 billion by 2034, driven by sustainability demand and aluminum's 100% recyclability. The report highlights innovations in printed electronics and temperature-sensitive inks creating premium packaging opportunities, with the smart aluminum beverage can market projected to reach $1.2 billion by 2026.

item.title: Steel prices today, January 31st: Declining on international markets
item.description: Global steel prices declined on January 31 due to increased iron ore inventory pressure at Chinese ports. Domestic markets in Vietnam held steady ahead of Tet holiday.

item.title: IIT-M develops green method to recover metals from e-waste using natural solvents
item.description: Researchers at IIT Madras developed a sustainable method to recover valuable metals from electronic waste using environment-friendly solvents derived from natural compounds like thymol and capric acid. Unlike conventional acid-based extraction techniques, this green solvent approach is non-toxic, water-efficient, and generates no hazardous waste, with potential applications for scaling up industrial recycling processes.

item.title: Nickel Industries showcases sustainability in quarterly update
item.description: Nickel Industries Limited reported stable operational performance in its Q4 2025 quarterly activities report, achieving a zero Lost Time Injury Frequency Rate (LTIFR) over 12 months with 17.7 million safe man-hours. The company completed a strategic acquisition of a 10% stake in Excelsior Nickel Cobalt and received national recognition for sustainability leadership, including the Indonesia Leadership Award 2025 and CNBC Indonesia's Excellence in Sustainability Leadership Award.

item.title: Nickel Industry News, Views and Commentary - Chronickels
item.description: The Nickel Institute published a new series on sustainability and innovations in nickel production, featuring an interview with Dr. Mark McArthur from NOVONIX about patented all-dry, zero-waste cathode synthesis technology designed to reduce costs and environmental impact of nickel-based cathode production. The article also discusses nickel's role in green hydrogen, electric vehicles, and cellulosic ethanol production as part of the energy transition.

item.title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
item.description: Copper futures dropped more than 3% to around $6 per pound on Friday, reversing a sharp rally amid profit-taking after surging to record levels. Copper fell to 5.97 USD/Lbs on January 30, 2026, down 3.80% from the previous day, despite monthly gains of 5.03% and yearly increase of 40.26%. The retreat aligned with a broader pullback in the metals complex and a rebounding dollar.

item.title: Copper Prices Are Tumbling, and a Larger Correction Could Be ...
item.description: Copper prices hit a record above $14,000 per ton on Thursday but dropped sharply to around $13,800 on Friday, mirroring declines in gold and silver. Goldman Sachs warns of a potential larger correction in mid-2026, possibly triggered by US tariffs on refined copper. Analysts note speculation has driven prices beyond fundamentals, especially with soft demand in China.

item.title: Why is copper price down and will it rise again or continue to fall ...
item.description: Copper prices fell after record highs due to profit-booking in Shanghai and London markets, with Shanghai futures down 2.82% to 103,680 yuan per ton and LME at $13,278.50 per ton. Weak Chinese demand is evident from low Yangshan premiums and spot discounts, alongside a stronger dollar. Long-term fundamentals remain positive with tight supply, potential rate cuts, and investor interest.

item.title: Aluminum output: Global body says production of primary aluminium up over 3% on month in Dec
item.description: Global primary aluminium production rose over 3% month-on-month in December 2025, per international data. This reflects ongoing capacity utilization trends in the sector.

item.title: ALUMINIUM 2026: Pioneering Sustainability and Innovation
item.description: The world's leading aluminum trade fair will take place October 6–8, 2026, in Düsseldorf, Germany, organized by RX Global. The event will emphasize sustainability, secondary aluminum's role in decarbonization, and innovations in metal processing, recycling, casting, automation, and surface finishing, with new elements including Hall 7A and dedicated sustainability conferences.

item.title: ALUMINIUM 2026: Driving Innovation for a Sustainable Future
item.description: ALUMINIUM 2026 will highlight sustainability as its central theme, with particular focus on secondary aluminum for decarbonization and coverage of metal processing, recycling, automation, and surface finishing. The event will feature proven formats like themed pavilions alongside fresh concepts for networking and business development.

item.title: Glencore 2025 copper output falls 11%
item.description: Glencore's copper production fell 11% in 2025 to 851,600 metric tonnes, though second-half output improved significantly due to higher grades and better recoveries at key mines. Rio Tinto has until February 5 to make a firm bid for Glencore, which could create the world's biggest miner controlling almost 10% of global copper output.

item.title: Copper gains ground, bolstering mining companies' 2026 profits outlook
item.description: Copper is expected to account for over 35% of diversified miners' earnings in 2026. Rio Tinto has increased copper output by 54% since 2019 following the Oyu Tolgoi project ramp-up, significantly outpacing competitors like BHP's 11% increase.

item.title: [SMM Announcement] on publishing Copper grade 1 cathode premium, ddp Midwest US on February 1, 2026
item.description: Shanghai Metals Market officially launched the Copper grade 1 cathode premium pricing for delivery to the Midwest US on February 1, 2026.

item.description: Spot aluminum prices experienced a significant correction last Friday, with A00 aluminum falling 200 yuan/mt to 24,660 yuan/mt and SMM ADC12 dropping to 24,350 yuan/mt. Aluminum alloy futures closed slightly up at 22,875 yuan/mt, while aluminum scrap prices pulled back amid high costs and supply tightness. Approaching Chinese New Year, secondary aluminum alloy prices are expected to hover at highs due to limited downside.

item.title: US ALUMINUM: Trade uncertainty, supply tightness push Midwest Premium above $1/lb
item.description: Trade uncertainty and supply tightness in the US aluminum market have driven the Midwest Premium above $1 per pound. This reflects ongoing challenges in the domestic aluminum sector amid global trade dynamics. The development underscores tightening supply conditions in the region.

Provisional prices for the first ten-day period of February are set at 3,700 for wire rod and 3,400 for rebar. The benchmark monthly discount rate for acceptance bills is 1.35‰.

item.description: During China's 14th Five-Year Plan period, steel production was reduced by over 100 million metric tons. This cut reflects efforts to address overcapacity in the steel sector.

item.description: LME copper prices continued their downward trend, while the SHFE/LME price ratio strengthened amid market premiums rising due to import incentives. Warrant prices averaged higher at $30-48/mt for QP February, with transactions concentrated around $30-40/mt. Offers for B/L and ER copper cargoes showed increased premiums, signaling heating pre-holiday activity.

item.description: Copper prices fell 2.01% to 5.8051 USD/Lbs, extending losses in a broader metals selloff after reaching all-time highs last week. The decline followed profit-taking amid reassessed fundamentals, with impacts from China's speculation reversal and US policy signals. Long-term support persists from supply constraints and demand expectations.

item.title: Alara Resources Dispatches 35th Copper Concentrate Shipment from Oman Mine
item.description: Alara Resources announced the dispatch of its 35th shipment of copper concentrate from the Al Wash-hi Majaza copper-gold mine in Oman, containing 283 tonnes of copper and 3.5 kg of gold. January 2026 marked a record high for monthly copper concentrate dispatches with approximately 4243 WMT shipped. The company continues exploration at other Omani projects.

item.title: Advancing Nickel MMC Coatings: Electroplating Models, Tooling Innovations for Hard Chromium Alternatives
item.description: The EU-funded MOZART project develops nickel dispersion coatings enriched with nanoparticles as a sustainable alternative to hard chromium plating, achieving hardness up to 1,000 HV. It integrates electrochemical characterization and CAE technology to predict nanoparticle content in deposits and designs custom plating tooling. This innovation supports eco-friendly electroplating for various components.

item.title: The first Energy Release contract in the Aosta Valley is underway: agreement signed between the CVA Group and Cogne Acciai Speciali
item.description: CVA will construct four new photovoltaic plants in Sicily with over 20 MW capacity, expected to produce 593,600 MWh fully operational by 2026. This marks the first Energy Release agreement in the Aosta Valley and supports Cogne Acciai Speciali's green energy transition and reduced environmental impact of production.

item.title: Cogne Acciai Speciali mulls expansion in U.S.
item.description: After four acquisitions over the past two years, Italian stainless steel and nickel alloy producer Cogne Acciai Speciali is considering further growth in the U.S. market. The company secured EUR 245 million through two capital increases to fund previous acquisitions and is preparing for its next expansion move.

item.title: Aluminum Falls from Over 3-Year High
item.description: Aluminum futures in the UK fell to $3,100 per tonne, retreating sharply from the over three-year high of $3,270 on January 28th as traders reconsidered speculative positions. Trading volumes for base metals in China remained at unprecedented highs, indicating position closures after metals tested peaks. Aluminum fell to 3,054.20 USD/T on February 2, down 2.04% from the previous day.

item.title: Uzbekistan Launches Its First Aluminum Can Plant with IFC Support to Drive Sustainable Production
item.description: Uzbekistan has launched its first greenfield aluminum can production plant in Tashkent with IFC's $18 million investment, aiming to supply recyclable metal packaging to beverage producers and reduce import reliance. The facility will produce up to 1.1 billion cans annually using energy-efficient equipment, create over 200 jobs, and align with climate goals through sustainable practices. IFC will also support environmental standards and green building certification.

item.title: Green Steel Production: Hydrogen Tech & Future Trends
item.description: This article examines hydrogen-driven green steel production technologies that are revolutionizing manufacturing in 2026, focusing on how hydrogen technology is transforming the steel industry toward more sustainable practices.

item.title: Copper Extends Losses in Broad Metal Selloff

item.title: Copper is down by 2.01%
item.description: Copper decreased 2.01% to 5.8051 USD/Lbs as part of recent market movements. This reflects short-term downward pressure in commodity trading.

item.title: The hidden powers of porous copper
item.description: Researchers at Arizona State University have developed a 3D-printing method using micro continuous liquid interface production (µCLIP) to create intricate copper components with nanoscale pores. This innovation allows engineering copper to intentionally oxidize for applications in information security, such as self-destructing chips exposed to air. The technology also supports sustainable manufacturing and medical implants that safely disintegrate.

item.title: Nickel Declines from Recent Peak
item.description: Nickel futures in the UK sank to $17,700 per tonne after hovering near the 19-month high of $19,000 throughout January. The decline tracks drops in other base metals due to a rebounding dollar triggering the close of speculative positions. Contracts remain sharply higher since the start of the year.

item.title: Steel Prices Rising Again? February 2026 Metal Market Update
item.description: This market update discusses rising steel mill prices and extended lead times in the metal roofing industry, alongside tight aluminum supply reaching four-year price highs. The analysis covers how energy costs and winter weather are impacting production, why inventory levels remain lean across the supply chain, and recommendations for contractors managing Q1 and Q2 projects.

item.title: Nickel Prices Plunge as Macro Fund Outflows and High Inventories Weigh on Market
item.description: On February 2, 2026, nickel prices experienced limit-down declines due to macro fund outflows and high inventories, with LME stocks over 280,000 mt and domestic visible inventory elevated. China's refined nickel production rose 20% month-on-month in January, increasing supply pressure amid weak downstream demand. Short-term pressure persists, but Indonesian quota reductions could support a rebound.

item.title: Aluminum Hits 4-week Low
item.description: Aluminum decreased to 3031.00 USD/T, marking the lowest since January 2026. Over the past 4 weeks, prices gained 4.06%, and in the last 12 months, increased 20.13%. This reflects recent market volatility in the commodity.

item.title: What Contractors Need to Know About Metal Prices Right Now
item.description: Steel market prices continue to rise at domestic mills with slightly increased production. Discussion covers rising steel prices, extended lead times, energy impacts, and lean inventories. Advice for contractors on managing projects and margins amid volatility.

item.title: Creation of a Leading Gold and Copper Producer
item.description: Eldorado and Foran announce a transaction to combine into a leading gold and copper producer, with world-class projects like McIlvenna Bay and Skouries entering commercial production in mid-2026. The combined entity highlights high-margin free cash flow, strong balance sheet, and enhanced copper exposure from long-life assets. Emerging scanning technologies and orebody knowledge studies are redefining near-mine opportunities at McIlvenna Bay.

item.title: Rare Earth Newsletter (February 2, 2026) - A Weekly Intelligence Brief
item.description: This intelligence brief covers the U.S. critical minerals sector, noting 100% import reliance for 12 minerals and highlighting nickel's market volatility as a financing risk. The report identifies opportunities in stockpiling, diversification, and demand growth potential, with storage technology expected to outperform through 2030.

item.title: US aluminium prices break away as tariffs collide with global supply strain
item.description: US aluminium prices surged past USD 5000/tonne due to tariffs boosting domestic production like Century Aluminum's Mt. Holly restart (50kt idle capacity reactivated, full by June), falling imports, and shrinking stocks. Global strains include South32's Mozal smelter deactivation in Mozambique and Century's Grundartangi output cut by two-thirds in Iceland due to equipment issues.

item.title: Nuton: A better way to produce copper
item.description: Rio Tinto's Nuton technology is enabling the Johnson Camp mine to become the lowest-carbon primary copper producer, setting a new benchmark for sustainability in copper mining. The technology drives lower emissions and improved environmental performance. It represents a significant advancement in sustainable copper production methods.

item.title: FHE materials bend the rules
item.description: Screen-printed copper-based circuits for flexible hybrid electronics (FHE) offer cost-efficiency, mechanical flexibility, and environmental benefits. These innovations expand possibilities in electronics manufacturing. The technology emphasizes sustainability through reduced material use and adaptability.

item.title: [SMM Nickel Sulphate Daily Review] February 3: Weak Sentiment in Both Purchasing and Sales, Nickel Salt Prices Decline
item.description: On February 3, the SMM battery-grade nickel sulphate index price stood at 31,939 yuan/mt. Weak sentiment affected both purchasing and sales, leading to declining prices for nickel salt. This reflects ongoing market pressures in the nickel sulphate segment.

item.title: Aluminum and copper prices take breather after explosive start to 2026
item.description: Aluminum prices steadied at $3,197.50 a ton on the LME, the highest in over three years, following a strong start to 2026 amid bullish industrial metals run. Concerns include potential softening Chinese demand and geopolitical risks from US tariffs on countries trading with Iran.

item.title: Prysmian signs €2.3 billion contract for UK power link project
item.description: Italian cable maker Prysmian has signed a contract worth over €2.3 billion with SP Energy Networks and National Grid to build a power link between Scotland and England. The project, called Eastern Green Link 4, will connect the electrical grids of Scotland and England as part of a significant infrastructure project for the Italian firm.

item.title: US ALUMINUM: Historically wide spreads in prime scrap market change 2026 contract behavior
item.description: Wide spreads in US aluminum scrap markets, driven by record Midwest premiums, tariff uncertainty, and supply-demand shifts, are disrupting 2026 contracts. UBC scrap prices averaged 111.25 cents/lb in January, at 46% of MWT costs, down from prior norms. Buyers and sellers hesitate on long-term deals amid policy volatility and scrap gluts.

item.title: Aluminum Prices Soar to Four-Year High, Creating a Divide in U.S. Industry
item.description: Aluminum prices on the LME have reached four-year highs, with US premiums exceeding $1 per pound, benefiting upstream producers like Alcoa and Century Aluminum while straining downstream manufacturers. Century Aluminum's Mt. Holly facility will add only 50,000 tons of capacity soon, insufficient to ease the supply deficit. Chinese producers profit from exports amid global tightness.

item.title: Robin Zeng: Unlocking the Sustainable Energy Era with Zero Carbon Technology
item.description: Dr. Robin Zeng, Chairman and CEO of CATL, discussed the future of sustainable energy, highlighting renewable energy applications and grid-forming energy storage technology. CATL has achieved industry-leading recovery rates of 99.6% for nickel and cobalt, and 96.5% for lithium, demonstrating commitment to circular economy principles in zero-carbon energy systems.

item.title: Pipe producer tightens its grip on giant Black Sea project with double contract win
item.description: Tenaris secured a double contract win for the Sakarya Gas Project in the Black Sea. The contracts involve providing advanced tubular and pipeline solutions for Phase 3 development in ultra-deepwater conditions. This strengthens Tenaris's involvement in Turkey's major offshore gas initiative.

item.title: Can-ification: Aluminium's Role in Circular Packaging
item.description: This article discusses aluminum cans as trusted solutions for sustainable beverage packaging, emphasizing their role in circular economy initiatives and sustainable packaging practices.

item.title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
item.description: HRC Steel fell to 971.06 USD/T on February 5, 2026, down 0.51% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen 4.08%. Forecasts indicate trading at 986.72 USD/T by quarter-end and 1065.02 USD/T in 12 months.

item.title: Global Iron and Steel Prices and News 05.02.2026
item.description: Daily updates on global iron and steel prices, including Shanghai Futures Rebar terms and regional futures for Turkey, China, Europe, and North America as of February 3-4, 2026. Provides indices, analyses, and market comments.

item.title: Copper Prices Pull Back Sharply, Downstream Users Replenish Stocks Moderately, Spot Premiums Rise Significantly [SMM Southern China Spot Copper]
item.description: Spot copper prices in Guangdong fell sharply, with #1 copper cathode averaging 101,565 yuan/mt, down 3,075 yuan/mt from the previous day. Downstream users moderately replenished stocks amid the pullback, while traders actively purchased for arbitrage, leading to improved trading and significantly higher spot premiums. Guangdong inventory increased slightly due to higher arrivals.

item.title: Copper Prices Retreat Amid Demand Concerns
item.description: Copper prices reversed earlier gains amid signs of softening demand, with LME inventories rising in Asian warehouses and extra spot cargoes moving from Africa to China. China's Nonferrous Metals Industry Association forecasts a 5% increase in refined copper output this year, dampening investor enthusiasm despite calls for strategic reserves. This bearish sentiment overshadows initial positive reactions to reserve-boosting suggestions.

item.title: Latest updates on metals prices worldwide at 0200 GMT, Feb. 5
item.description: London Stock Exchange Group reported copper prices at 5.83 USD at 0200 GMT on Feb. 5. This update includes prices for other metals like gold at 4,988.00 USD and iron ore at 102.17 USD. The data reflects the latest worldwide metals pricing snapshot.

item.title: Refined copper output growth to slow in 2026: ICSG
item.description: Copper output growth is expected to slow to 0.9% in 2026, down from 3.4% in 2025, according to Paul White at the World Copper Conference. World copper mine production is forecast to rise by 2.3%, while refined copper usage grows by 2.1%, leading to a 150,000-metric ton market deficit.

item.title: Copper Prices Retreat Amid Demand Concerns
item.description: Copper prices reversed gains due to softening demand signals, rising LME inventories in Asia, and extra supply from Africa to China. China's Nonferrous Metals Industry Association forecasts a 5% increase in refined copper output this year. This offsets earlier positivity from calls to boost strategic reserves.

item.title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel Prices Drop Slightly on February 5 as US January ADP Employment Data Falls Short of Expectations
item.description: On February 5, SMM #1 refined nickel prices averaged 139,850 yuan/mt, down 1,750 yuan/mt from the previous day, amid weak US ADP employment data. The SHFE nickel futures contract (2603) closed at 133,510 yuan/mt, down 1.79%. Despite macro pressures, expectations for reduced nickel ore quotas in Indonesia suggest potential future rebounds.

item.title: Nickel prices surge on Feb 5 amid concerns over trade war ease
item.description: LME nickel futures rose by US$265/ton to close at US$15,535/ton on February 5. The nickel spot price also increased amid easing concerns over trade wars. This surge reflects positive market sentiment in the nickel sector.

item.title: [SMM Analysis] Nickel Sulphate Prices Edge Down as Chinese New Year Approaches Amid Weak Market Sentiment
item.description: The SMM battery-grade nickel sulphate index stood at 31,939 yuan/mt as of Thursday, with prices edging down ahead of Chinese New Year. Weak market sentiment contributed to the decline in nickel sulphate quotations. This reflects broader softening in nickel-related products.

item.title: Nornickel sees 2026 nickel output broadly in line with previous year
item.description: Russia's Nornickel, the world's largest palladium producer and major nickel producer, expects 2026 nickel output of 193,000–203,000 metric tons, broadly in line with 2025 production of 198,521 tons. The company attributes recent production declines to ore reserve depletion and Western sanctions restricting equipment access, but expects recovery by 2028 through development of the Oktyabrskoye deposit.

item.title: Acciaierie d'Italia to start preferential negotiations with Azerbaijani consortium on acquisition of former Ilva plants
item.description: Extraordinary commissioners of Acciaierie d’Italia and ILVA in extraordinary administration have requested authorization from Italy’s Ministry of Enterprises and Made in Italy to begin preferential negotiations with an Azerbaijani consortium (Baku Steel Company CJSC and Azerbaijan Investment Company OJSC) for the sale of the former Ilva steel plants.[8] Ten proposals had been received by the January 10 deadline, and the chosen consortium was selected based on criteria including financial stability, industrial sustainability, and expected benefits for employment and local communities.[8]
